intro: Stenorrhynchos, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. These plants are characterized by their fleshy, thick leaves and showy, clustered flowers that often come in shades of violet, pink, and white. Stenorrhynchos species are typically herbaceous perennials, thriving in moist, well-drained soil. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care. The genus includes several species, with Stenorrhynchos cinnabarinus being one of the most widely cultivated varieties.
